results.text: The instrument or tool you use to perform suddenly breaks. If your tool is a part of your body (such as your voice or your feet) you have a persistent condition like a rolled ankle or a frog in your throat. You cannot roll another Performance check until you spend an hour fixing your equipment or resting your voice or body.
You forgot how to play or perform your bit, either because you are too nervous or intoxicated. Your next Performance check is made at disadvantage.
For one reason or another your performance didn’t land with this audience quite the way you imagined. The attitude of the creatures who witnessed this decreases by one step.
There’s a song playing over and over again in your head and it’s starting to drive you crazy. You have disadvantage on your next initiative roll.
You have run afoul of the local authorities for disturbing the peace with your racket. You must pay a fine (amount determined by the Narrator) or be arrested.
You are so consumed with your current work you forget to take a break to rest or even eat. You gain a level of Strife.
